content: Kirsten Sinema, the moderate Democrat who played a key role in the negotiations, released a statement praising the agreement. "I'm relieved that we have finally reached a deal to reopen the government and provide certainty for federal workers," she said. "I'm proud to have worked with my colleagues on both sides of the aisle to find a path forward, and I remain committed to working together to find a long-term solution to secure our borders and keep our country safe." Ms. Sinema's efforts to find a middle ground were credited with helping to break the impasse and bring the shutdown to an end.
